subject: Re: [junit] J2EE "patterns"
msgSnippet: J. B. Rainsberger wrote: [[[ I do not react well to calling J2EE implementation idioms patterns . They are hacks designed to increase performance and work
messageBody:
J. B. Rainsberger wrote:

[[[
I do not react well to calling J2EE implementation idioms "patterns".
They are hacks designed to increase performance and work around the
obvious limitations and faulty intentions of J2EE.
]]]

You can take this reasoning quite a-ways:

http://norvig.com/design-patterns/img010.gif

to the point where if you're not using Lisp or something very like
it, most patterns are hacks.

In the meantime... ;)

Bill de hÓra
